meanings.definition: Of or relating to an orifice.
meanings.sent1: The dentist examined the orificial area carefully.
meanings.sent2: The key served as the orificial tool to open the lock.
meanings.sent3: The orificial inspection made everyone giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like orificial windows to her soul.
meanings.sent5: The orificial design of the building was both functional and elegant.

meanings.definition: Serving as an opening or entrance.
meanings.sent1: The orificial gate welcomed visitors to the park.
meanings.sent2: The cave served as the orificial passage to the hidden chamber.
meanings.sent3: The orificial invitation to the party was beautifully designed.
meanings.sent4: His smile was the orificial gateway to his friendly personality.
meanings.sent5: The orificial arch of the bridge was grand and impressive.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the mouth or other bodily openings.
meanings.sent1: The orificial examination of the patient's mouth was thorough.
meanings.sent2: The doctor explained the orificial functions of the digestive system.
meanings.sent3: The orificial taste of the new dish surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was the orificial sound of joy in the room.
meanings.sent5: The orificial scent of the flowers filled the garden with fragrance.
